content: ## Identifying the Inputs 1. The A (left) and B (right) buttons are available in code as `buttonA` and `buttonB` respectively. These buttons are identical to each other aside from location on the board. 2. The **Reset Button** isn't actually available for you to use in your program. Clicking this button causes the micro:bit to reset itself, so avoid clicking it while running a program. It is useful, however, if your board isn't functioning the way you expect. ## Events and Event Types | Event Type | Description | |---|---| | `down` | Triggers when the button is pressed down.| | `up` | Triggers when the button pops back up after being pressed.| ## Button States Both buttons and the switch have only two states. Buttons are usually off (false) and turn on (true) when pressed. You can see if a button is being pressed with [`buttonL.isPressed`(#f78183)](/docs/applab/isPressed/).
